# enableWaterLock()

**Instance Method**

Disables the Apple Watch touch screen to prevent accidental taps while submerged.

## Declaration

```swift
func enableWaterLock()
```

## Discussion

The following rules apply when using Water Lock:

- You must call the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice/enableWaterLock()] method from the main thread.
- You can only enable Water Lock when the app is running in the foreground during an active workout or location session.
- The app must be running on a supported device (the [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice] object’s [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceDevice/waterResistanceRating] property must be [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKWaterResistanceRating/wr50]).
- Water Lock remains active until the user unlocks it. You can’t programmatically unlock the watch.

## Accessing Water Resistance and Lock

- **waterResistanceRating**: The Apple Watch water-resistance rating.
- **WKWaterResistanceRating**: Values indicating the water-resistance rating.
- **isWaterLockEnabled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the water lock is enabled.
